metadata.title: FedRAMP Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M)

roles.title: FedRAMP Program Management Office
roles.description: The FedRAMP PMO resides within GSA and supports agencies and cloud service providers through the FedRAMP authorization process and maintains a secure repository of FedRAMP authorizations to enable reuse of security packages

roles.title: FedRAMP Program Management Office
roles.description: Members of the JAB include the chief information officers (CIOs) from the Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, and General Services Administration. The JAB serves as the primary governance and decision-making body for FedRAMP.

roles.title: Prepared By
roles.description: The organization that prepared this SSP. If developed in-house, this is the CSP itself.

roles.title: Prepared For
roles.description: The organization for which this SSP was prepared. Typically the CSP.

roles.title: System Security Plan Approval
roles.description: he individual or individuals accountable for the accuracy of this SSP.

roles.title: Cloud Service Provider (CSP) Name
roles.description: Cloud Service Provider used by the client

roles.title: Information System Owner
roles.description: The individual within the CSP who is ultimately accountable for everything related to this system.

roles.title: Authorizing Official
roles.description: The individual or individuals who must grant this system an authorization to operate.

roles.title: Authorizing Official's Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual representing the authorizing official.

roles.title: Information System Management Point of Contact (POC)
roles.description: The highest level manager who responsible for system operation on behalf of the System Owner.

roles.title: Information System Technical Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual or individuals leading the technical operation of the system.

roles.title: System Information System Security Officer (or Equivalent)
roles.description: The individual accountable for the security posture of the system on behalf of the system owner.

roles.title: Privacy Official's Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual responsible for the privacy threshold analysis and if necessary the privacy impact assessment.

roles.title: General Point of Contact (POC)
roles.description: A general point of contact for the system, designated by the system owner.

components.title: Tenable Scanning Tool
components.description: Tenable Vulnerability Management is a cloud-based platform that identifies, assesses, and prioritizes vulnerabilities across IT assets. It uses real-time threat intelligence and asset context to help organizations focus on and remediate the most critical security risks.
components.remarks: This is a scanning tool referenced as a source by a POA&M entry.

components.title: Qualys Scanning Tool
components.description: Qualys VMDR (Vulnerability Management, Detection, and Response) is a cloud-based platform that continuously detects, prioritizes, and remediates vulnerabilities across global IT assets. It combines asset inventory, vulnerability scanning, threat intelligence, and patch management into a single integrated workflow.
components.remarks: This is a scanning tool referenced as a source by a POA&M entry.

components.title: Fortify Authorization
components.description: Handles authorization processes, ensuring only authenticated and authorized users or services can access system resources.

props.name: authentication-method
props.remarks: The Fortify Authorization service implements several authentication methods to ensure secure access to the ACME Pro Application. The primary methods used are:1. **Password-Based Authentication**: Each user is assigned a unique username and password, which is required for initial login. Passwords must meet complexity requirements, including a mix of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and special characters.2. **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: MFA is mandatory for all users accessing the ACME Pro Application, especially for privileged accounts. This method requires users to provide an additional verification factor, such as a security key or a mobile authenticator app, after entering their password. This enhances security by ensuring that access is granted only when multiple forms of identification are verified.3. **Single Sign-On (SSO)**: The system supports SSO through Azure Entra, allowing users to authenticate once and gain access to multiple applications without needing to log in separately for each one. This is particularly useful for government agencies that may require integration with their existing identity management systems.4. **Session Management**: Users are required to re-authenticate after periods of inactivity (e.g., 15 minutes), and sessions will terminate if there is no response within five minutes of a prompt. This helps

components.title: Azure System
components.description: Azure System is a Leveraged Auth System for package: Azure Commercial Cloud

props.name: authentication-method
props.remarks: In Microsoft Azure Commercial Cloud, authentication is primarily managed through Azure Active Directory (AAD), which supports various methods to ensure secure access to resources.1. **Password-based Authentication**: Users authenticate by entering their username and password. Azure enforces strong password policies to enhance security.2. **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: Azure supports MFA, requiring users to provide additional verification (such as a code sent to their mobile device) alongside their password. This adds an extra layer of security to the authentication process.3. **Single Sign-On (SSO)**: Azure enables SSO, allowing users to access multiple applications with one set of credentials. This is facilitated through AAD, which manages user sessions and tokens across integrated applications.4. **Conditional Access Policies**: Azure implements conditional access, which evaluates user context (such as location, device state, and risk level) before granting access. This ensures that authentication requirements can adapt based on the user's situation.These authentication methods are integrated into the Azure platform, providing a robust framework for managing user identities and securing access to cloud resources.

observations.description: The remote Apache Tomcat server is affected by a file read and inclusion vulnerability.
The remote SSL/TLS service supports the use of RC4 ciphers.
A component used by the web application is potentially vulnerable to Denial of Service.
The remote MySQL server is not running the latest patch release for its major version.
The remote web server discloses its version number in the HTTP response headers.
The remote web server does not send the HTTP Strict-Transport-Security header.
Apache Tomcat AJP Connector Request Smuggling Vulnerability Detected.
The SSL/TLS server supports the use of the RC4 cipher suite.
The web application utilizes a version of Newtonsoft.Json library which is vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS).
The MySQL Server version detected is outdated.
The web server reveals its version information via the 'Server' HTTP header.
The web application does not send the HTTP Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS) header.

risks.title: Apache Tomcat AJP 'Ghostcat' File Read / Inclusion (CVE-2020-1938)
risks.description: Based on its configuration, the Apache Tomcat AJP connector running on the remote host is vulnerable to the 'Ghostcat' vulnerability (CVE-2020-1938). An unauthenticated, remote attacker can exploit this, via a specially crafted AJP request, to read arbitrary files from the web application directories. If file uploads are enabled within the webroot, this could potentially lead to remote code execut
risks.statement: The remote Apache Tomcat server is affected by a file read and inclusion vulnerability.

remediations.title: Planned Remediation
remediations.description: Upgrade Apache Tomcat to version 7.0.100, 8.5.51, 9.0.31 or later. \nAlternatively, if the AJP connector is not needed, disable it in the server.xml configuration file. \nIf AJP is required, ensure the port is firewalled from untrusted networks and configure a strong secret using the 'requiredSecret' or 'secret' attribute in the AJP Connector directive.

risks.title: SSL/TLS Server Supports RC4 Cipher Algorithms (CVE-2013-2566, CVE-2015-2808)
risks.description: The remote host's SSL/TLS service supports connections using the RC4 cipher suite. RC4 is known to have cryptographic weaknesses, including susceptibility to the Bar Mitzvah attack (CVE-2015-2808) and other biases (CVE-2013-2566), which could potentially allow an attacker to recover plaintext from encrypted sessions under certain conditions. RC4 ciphers should be disabled.
risks.statement: The remote SSL/TLS service supports the use of RC4 ciphers.

remediations.title: Planned Remediation
remediations.description: Reconfigure the affected application or operating system (Windows Schannel) to disable support for RC4 cipher suites. Prioritize the use of strong, modern cipher suites such as AES-GCM or ChaCha20-Poly1305.

risks.title: Web Application Component Vulnerability - Newtonsoft.Json DoS (CVE-2020-8203)
risks.description: The web application running on the target host appears to utilize a version of the Newtonsoft.Json library prior to 12.0.3. This library is susceptible to a Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability (CVE-2020-8203) when deserializing specially crafted JSON input if insecure TypeNameHandling settings (such as 'All', 'Objects', or 'Arrays') are enabled. Exploitation can lead to a stack overflow, crashin
risks.statement: A component used by the web application is potentially vulnerable to Denial of Service.

remediations.title: Planned Remediation
remediations.description: Update the Newtonsoft.Json library dependency to version 12.0.3 or later within the server-side .NET application. Review and avoid insecure TypeNameHandling settings where possible, or implement a custom SerializationBinder for stricter type validation. Redeploy the application with the updated library.

risks.title: MySQL Server Outdated Patch Level
risks.description: The MySQL server running on the remote host reported its version as 8.0.28. According to Tenable's database, the latest available patch release within the 8.0 series is newer (e.g., 8.0.35 or later). Running software that is not fully patched increases the risk of exposure to vulnerabilities fixed in subsequent patch releases.
risks.statement: The remote MySQL server is not running the latest patch release for its major version.

remediations.title: Planned Remediation
remediations.description: Consult the vendor's documentation (MySQL release notes and AWS RDS updates) and apply the latest available patch update for the MySQL 8.0 series through the AWS RDS management interface.

risks.title: HTTP Server Version Disclosure
risks.description: The web server running on the remote host reveals its software type and version in the 'Server' HTTP header (e.g., 'Apache-Coyote/1.1'). While not a vulnerability in itself, this information leakage simplifies reconnaissance for attackers seeking to exploit known vulnerabilities in specific server versions.
risks.statement: The remote web server discloses its version number in the HTTP response headers.

remediations.title: Planned Remediation
remediations.description: Configure the web server (Apache Tomcat) to avoid disclosing its version information. This can often be achieved by modifying the 'server' attribute within the relevant Connector directive(s) in the 'server.xml' file to a generic value or removing it entirely.

risks.title: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) Missing
risks.description: The web server does not send the 'Strict-Transport-Security' HTTP header. This security feature helps protect websites against protocol downgrade attacks and cookie hijacking by instructing browsers to only access the domain using HTTPS. Without HSTS, users may be vulnerable to Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attacks like SSL stripping.
risks.statement: The remote web server does not send the HTTP Strict-Transport-Security header.

remediations.title: Planned Remediation
remediations.description: Configure the web server or web application framework to send the 'Strict-Transport-Security' header for all HTTPS responses. Include a suitable 'max-age' value (e.g., 31536000 seconds for one year) and consider adding the 'includeSubDomains' and 'preload' directives if applicable.

risks.title: Apache Tomcat AJP Connector Request Smuggling Vulnerability (Ghostcat)
risks.description: An unauthenticated attacker with network access to the AJP port can read the content of any file within the web application's directory structure (e.g., source code, configuration files, sensitive data). If file uploads are possible within the webroot, this could escalate to RCE.
risks.statement: Apache Tomcat AJP Connector Request Smuggling Vulnerability Detected.

remediations.title: Planned Remediation
remediations.description: Upgrade Apache Tomcat to version 7.0.100, 8.5.51, 9.0.31 or later. Alternatively, if the AJP connector is not required, disable it by commenting out the relevant Connector directive in the server.xml configuration file. If AJP is required, ensure it is firewalled to only allow trusted connections and configure a 'secret' using the 'requiredSecret' attribute.

risks.title: TLS/SSL Server Supports RC4 Cipher Suite (Bar Mitzvah)
risks.description: An attacker who can perform a Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attack may be able to exploit this vulnerability to decrypt sensitive information transmitted over the TLS/SSL connection.
risks.statement: The SSL/TLS server supports the use of the RC4 cipher suite.

remediations.title: Planned Remediation
remediations.description: Disable the RC4 cipher suite on the Windows Server 2022 instance. This can typically be done via Group Policy (Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> SSL Configuration Settings -> SSL Cipher Suite Order) or direct registry modification under HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\SCHANNEL\Ciphers. Ensure stronger, modern cipher suites are prioritized.

risks.title: Newtonsoft.Json Denial of Service (DoS) Vulnerability
risks.description: An unauthenticated remote attacker could send crafted JSON data to an endpoint that uses the vulnerable library for deserialization with unsafe TypeNameHandling settings, causing the application process to crash due to a stack overflow, leading to a denial of service for legitimate users.
risks.statement: The web application utilizes a version of Newtonsoft.Json library which is vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS).

remediations.title: Planned Remediation
remediations.description: Update the Newtonsoft.Json NuGet package to version 12.0.3 or later within the .NET application project. Review the application's use of TypeNameHandling settings and avoid 'All', 'Objects', or 'Arrays' if possible. If required, use a custom SerializationBinder for stricter type control. Rebuild and redeploy the Docker container with the updated application.

risks.title: MySQL Server Outdated
risks.description: The database server might be vulnerable to publicly known security issues fixed in later patch releases of MySQL 8.0. Attackers could potentially exploit these vulnerabilities, depending on their severity and applicability (though often low/medium impact for minor patch differences).
risks.statement: The MySQL Server version detected is outdated.

remediations.title: Planned Remediation
remediations.description: Apply the latest available minor version update or patch release for MySQL 8.0 via the AWS RDS console or AWS CLI. Regularly schedule maintenance windows for patching RDS instances.

risks.title: Web Server HTTP Header Information Leakage
risks.description: Provides attackers with valuable reconnaissance information, allowing them to focus attacks based on known vulnerabilities in the identified server software (Apache Tomcat 9.0.x).
risks.statement: The web server reveals its version information via the 'Server' HTTP header.

remediations.title: Planned Remediation
remediations.description: Configure Tomcat to suppress or modify the 'Server' header. This can be done by editing the `server.xml` file and adding the `server` attribute to the Connector definition, setting it to a generic value (e.g., `server="Web Server"`) or removing it if possible (behavior varies by Tomcat version).

risks.title: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) Not Enforced
risks.description: Users accessing the site may be vulnerable to Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attacks like SSL stripping, where an attacker forces the connection down to HTTP, potentially exposing sensitive data or session cookies transmitted without encryption.
risks.statement: The web application does not send the HTTP Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS) header.

remediations.title: Planned Remediation
remediations.description: Configure the web application or web server (IIS/Kestrel) to send the Strict-Transport-Security header for all HTTPS responses. In a .NET Core/6+ application, this can be done using middleware: `app.UseHsts();`. Ensure an appropriate `max-age` value (e.g., 31536000 for one year) is set, and consider adding the `includeSubDomains` and `preload` directives.

poam-items.title: Tenable Risk: Web Application Component Vulnerability - Newtonsoft.Json DoS (CVE-2020-8203)
poam-items.description: The web application running on the target host appears to utilize a version of the Newtonsoft.Json library prior to 12.0.3. This library is susceptible to a Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability (CVE-2020-8203) when deserializing specially crafted JSON input if insecure TypeNameHandling settings (su

poam-items.title: Tenable Risk: MySQL Server Outdated Patch Level
poam-items.description: The MySQL server running on the remote host reported its version as 8.0.28. According to Tenable's database, the latest available patch release within the 8.0 series is newer (e.g., 8.0.35 or later). Running software that is not fully patched increases the risk of exposure to vulnerabilities fixed i

poam-items.title: Tenable Risk: HTTP Server Version Disclosure
poam-items.description: The web server running on the remote host reveals its software type and version in the 'Server' HTTP header (e.g., 'Apache-Coyote/1.1'). While not a vulnerability in itself, this information leakage simplifies reconnaissance for attackers seeking to exploit known vulnerabilities in specific server v

poam-items.title: Tenable Risk: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) Missing
poam-items.description: The web server does not send the 'Strict-Transport-Security' HTTP header. This security feature helps protect websites against protocol downgrade attacks and cookie hijacking by instructing browsers to only access the domain using HTTPS. Without HSTS, users may be vulnerable to Man-in-the-Middle (Mi

poam-items.title: Qualys Risk: Apache Tomcat AJP Connector Request Smuggling Vulnerability (Ghostcat)
poam-items.description: An unauthenticated attacker with network access to the AJP port can read the content of any file within the web application's directory structure (e.g., source code, configuration files, sensitive data). If file uploads are possible within the webroot, this could escalate to RCE.

poam-items.title: Qualys Risk: TLS/SSL Server Supports RC4 Cipher Suite (Bar Mitzvah)
poam-items.description: An attacker who can perform a Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attack may be able to exploit this vulnerability to decrypt sensitive information transmitted over the TLS/SSL connection.

poam-items.title: Qualys Risk: Newtonsoft.Json Denial of Service (DoS) Vulnerability
poam-items.description: An unauthenticated remote attacker could send crafted JSON data to an endpoint that uses the vulnerable library for deserialization with unsafe TypeNameHandling settings, causing the application process to crash due to a stack overflow, leading to a denial of service for legitimate users.

poam-items.title: Qualys Risk: MySQL Server Outdated
poam-items.description: The database server might be vulnerable to publicly known security issues fixed in later patch releases of MySQL 8.0. Attackers could potentially exploit these vulnerabilities, depending on their severity and applicability (though often low/medium impact for minor patch differences).

poam-items.title: Qualys Risk: Web Server HTTP Header Information Leakage
poam-items.description: Provides attackers with valuable reconnaissance information, allowing them to focus attacks based on known vulnerabilities in the identified server software (Apache Tomcat 9.0.x).

poam-items.title: Qualys Risk: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) Not Enforced
poam-items.description: Users accessing the site may be vulnerable to Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attacks like SSL stripping, where an attacker forces the connection down to HTTP, potentially exposing sensitive data or session cookies transmitted without encryption.
